event.title: settled under the name Kendon by the Northern Pacific Railway in 1886

data.event: Properly Green River Hot Springs, the town was first settled under the name Kendon by the Northern Pacific Railway in 1886.
By 1913–14 the town's population had dropped to 65, with no businesses mentioned.
Evidence points to the fact that sometime before 1913–14 the sanatorium had burned down.
By 1918, the town had virtually vanished, only being listed as a "Discontinued Post Office."
